scheme

Class CSV

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheme.CSV

  • public class CSV
extends Object
    Class for working with comma-separated values (CSVs) within scheme.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Main class for using scheme on the CLI.

        Prints file schemata to the standard output device.

        Usage:

        
 $ java --class-path scheme-1.0.jar <csvfile.csv>
        Parameters:
        args - list of CSV files for which schema should be determined

      • headerExtents

        public static int[] headerExtents()
        Returns the extents (line / row indices) which define the header region of the most recently-analysed CSV file.

        Returns int[]{-1, -1} if no header region was found. Otherwise, if both array elements are equal, then the header is just a single line.

        Returns:
        a two-element int array giving the first (inclusive) and last (exclusive) row index (0-based) of the header region

      • schema

        public static List<Map.Entry<String,Class<?>>> schema(String file)
                                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                      IOException
        Works just like schema(), but bool01, commonTypes, postfixFL, and parseDates are set to false, false, false, and true, respectively.
        Parameters:
        file - the path of the CSV file to parse
        Returns:
        a List<Entry<String, Class<?>>> describing the schema of this CSV file, where the String of each entry is the inferred column name and the Class is the inferred column class
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file refers to a file which does not exist
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the file

      • schema

        public static List<Map.Entry<String,Class<?>>> schema(String file,
                                                      boolean bool01,
                                                      boolean commonTypes,
                                                      boolean postfixFL,
                                                      boolean parseDates)
                                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                      IOException
        Works just like schema(), but firstHeaderRowIndex, lastHeaderRowIndex, and nTestRows are set to -1, -1, and 35, respectively.

        Setting firstHeaderRowIndex and lastHeaderRowIndex to -1 indicates that those values will be inferred by schema(), which performs an analysis of row types to determine the header row extents.

        Parameters:
        file - the path of the CSV file to parse
        bool01 - if true, '0' and '1' are interpreted as booleans
        commonTypes - if true, the returned class will only be one of four "common" classes -- Boolean, String, Double, and LocalDateTime
        postfixFL - if true, explicit floats and longs (i.e. "1.1F" or "13l") will be interpreted, otherwise, they're interpreted as Strings
        parseDates - if true, date-time-formatted Strings will be interpreted as LocalDateTimes, otherwise, they'll be left as Strings
        Returns:
        a List<Entry<String, Class<?>>> describing the schema of this CSV file, where the String of each entry is the inferred column name and the Class is the inferred column class
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file refers to a file which does not exist
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the file

      • schema

        public static List<Map.Entry<String,Class<?>>> schema(String file,
                                                      int firstHeaderRowIndex,
                                                      int lastHeaderRowIndex,
                                                      int nTestRows,
                                                      boolean bool01,
                                                      boolean commonTypes,
                                                      boolean postfixFL,
                                                      boolean parseDates)
                                               throws FileNotFoundException,
                                                      IOException
        Given a path to a CSV file, and a list of options, this method attempts to determine the schema of the data contained within the file.

        The schema is a List of Map.Entrys, where each Entry contains two values, (1) a String column name, and (2) a Class that's been inferred from the type of data contained within that column.

        If the user provides an invalid firstHeaderRowIndex or lastHeaderRowIndex, the columns will be labeled X1...XN, where N is the number of columns in the file.

        The minimum number of rows required to analyse and make a decent guess at the type of data contained within a column is 7. This, plus a 10-row metadata / header row buffer, is the minimum number of rows to be analysed. If the user provides a value for nTestRows that is less than 17, it will be increased to 17. Increase this value for a more confident guess at the type of data contained within a column.

        Parameters:
        file - the path of the CSV file to parse
        firstHeaderRowIndex - a fixed row / line index (0-based) for the beginning of the column header region
        lastHeaderRowIndex - a fixed row / line index (0-based) for the end of the column header region
        nTestRows - the number of rows to analyse for determining the types of data held within each column
        bool01 - if true, '0' and '1' are interpreted as booleans
        commonTypes - if true, the returned class will only be one of four "common" classes -- Boolean, String, Double, and LocalDateTime
        postfixFL - if true, explicit floats and longs (i.e. "1.1F" or "13l") will be interpreted, otherwise, they're interpreted as Strings
        parseDates - if true, date-time-formatted Strings will be interpreted as LocalDateTimes, otherwise, they'll be left as Strings
        Returns:
        a List<Entry<String, Class<?>>> describing the schema of this CSV file, where the String of each entry is the inferred column name and the Class is the inferred column class
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file refers to a file which does not exist
        IOException - if there was a problem reading the file
